intro: Porpax microchilos, commonly known as the small-chinned porpax, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
